title: TrainingMaterial (v0.7-DRAFT-2019_11_08)
description: The Life Science Training Materials specification provides a way to describe bioscience training material on the World Wide Web. It defines a set of metadata and vocabularies, built on top of existing technologies and standards, that can be used to represent events in Web pages and applications. The goal of the specification is to make it easier to discover, exchange and integrate life science training material information across the Internet.

@id.title: Link to other resource
@id.description: URL of page describing the resource

@id.title: Link to other resource
@id.description: URL of page describing the resource

Organization.title: Organization (v0.2-DRAFT-2019_07_19) Minimum Version
Organization.description: Provides a way to describe bioscience organizations on the World Wide Web. It defines metadata terms that can be used in the code of web pages and applications, and builds on top of existing technologies and standards. The goal of the specification is to make it easier to discover, exchange and integrate life science organization profiles across the Internet.

description.title: description (Minimum)
description.description: Schema.org: A description of the item.

legalName.title: legalName (Minimum)
legalName.description: Schema.org: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

name.title: name (Minimum)
name.description: Schema.org: The name of the item.

sameAs.title: sameAs (Minimum)
sameAs.description: Schema.org: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

topic.title: topic (Minimum)
topic.description: Bioschemas: Scientific topics that describe the organization and its activities, ideally using an ontology term from EDAM:Topic.

type.title: type (Minimum)
type.description: Bioschemas: The type of the organization should be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary column.

Person.title: Person (v0.2-DRAFT-2019_07_19) Minimum Version
Person.description: The Life Science Person specification provides a way to describe bioscience events on the World Wide Web. It defines a set of metadata and vocabularies, built on top of existing technologies and standards, that can be used to represent the profile information of people in Web pages and applications. The goal of the specification is to make it easier to discover, life science profile information.

description.title: description (Minimum)
description.description: Schema.org: A description of the item.

mainEntityOfPage.title: mainEntityOfPage (Minimum)
mainEntityOfPage.description:
Schema.org: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.
Inverse property: mainEntity.

name.title: name (Minimum)
name.description: Schema.org: The name of the item.

Event.title: Event (v0.2-DRAFT-2019_06_14) Minimum Version
Event.description: Specification for describing a Life Science event. This includes conferences, workshops, meetings, courses, receptions, networking and prizegivings.

contact.title: contact (Minimum)
contact.description: Bioschemas: Main point of contact that can be contacted for general queries. This would be an event organizer or an administrator.

description.title: description (Minimum)
description.description: Schema.org: A description of the item.

endDate.title: endDate (Minimum)
endDate.description: Schema.org: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date format).

eventType.title: eventType (Minimum)
eventType.description: Bioschemas: This can be one of 4 options. Please see controlled vocabulary

hostInstitution.title: hostInstitution (Minimum)
hostInstitution.description: Bioschemas: The organization or institution responsible for hosting the event (not necessarily responsible for organizing).

location.title: location (Minimum)
location.description: Bioschemas: The location of the event. It is recommended to use Place, and within [Place](http://schema.org/Place) use the [PostalAddress](http://schema.org/PostalAddress) and [GeoCoordinates](http://schema.org/GeoCoordinates). Schema.org: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

name.title: name (Minimum)
name.description: Schema.org: The name of the item.

startDate.title: startDate (Minimum)
startDate.description: Schema.org: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date format).

Course.title: Course (v0.9-DRAFT-2020_12_08) Minimum Version
Course.description:
This specification must be used in tandem with a courseInstance. A course is used to describe the broad, common aspects of a recurring training event - whereas a course instance is about the specific times and location of when that course is held.

Summary of Changes

Changes since previous draft 0.8 of the Course profile:
  • Update ranges as per latest version of schema.org

description.title: description (Minimum)
description.description: Schema.org: A description of the item.

keywords.title: keywords (Minimum)
keywords.description: Bioschemas: Free text keywords delimited by commas describing the Course content. Schema.org: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

name.title: name (Minimum)
name.description: Schema.org: The name of the item.

about.title: about (Recommended)
about.description: Bioschemas: The subject of this Training Material. Use the DefinedTerm type to add a controlled vocabulary term to describe the topic (such as from the EDAM ontology)  Schema.org: The subject matter of the content.

abstract.title: abstract (Recommended)
abstract.description: Schema.org: A brief overview of the item.

accessibilitySummary.title: accessibilitySummary (Optional)
accessibilitySummary.description: Schema.org: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

audience.title: audience (Recommended)
audience.description: Bioschemas: A succinct description of the intended target audience for your materials: e.g., graduates, postgraduates, clinicians. Schema.org: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created. Supersedes serviceAudience.

author.title: author (Recommended)
author.description: Bioschemas: Those involved in the preparation, creation and/or presentation of the published work, specifically creating the original version. Schema.org: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

contributor.title: contributor (Optional)
contributor.description:
Bioschemas: Contributors are those who made non-authorship contributions: e.g., critical review, commentary or revision.
 Schema.org: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

dateCreated.title: dateCreated (Optional)
dateCreated.description: Schema.org: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

dateModified.title: dateModified (Optional)
dateModified.description: Schema.org: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

description.title: description (Minimum)
description.description: Schema.org: A description of the item.

featuredInEvent.title: featuredInEvent (Optional)
featuredInEvent.description: Bioschemas: Use isPartOf to refer to a Course, unless this Training Material is unique to a specific Course Instance. Schema.org: The course instance or event where this training material was or will be featured. Inverse of workFeatured.

hasPart.title: hasPart (Optional)
hasPart.description: Bioschemas: A sub-Training Material or externally referenced Training Material. Schema.org: Event

identifier.title: identifier (Recommended)
identifier.description:
Bioschemas: An identifier for this Training Material, such as a DOI or compact URI
 Schema.org: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](http://schema.org/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

inLanguage.title: inLanguage (Recommended)
inLanguage.description:
Bioschemas: Defaults to English if not specified. Please choose a value from [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).
You can add multiple languages if the Training Material offers different translations Schema.org: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also [availableLanguage](http://schema.org/availableLanguage). Supersedes language.

isPartOf.title: isPartOf (Optional)
isPartOf.description:
Bioschemas: The Course in which this Training Material was/will be used, or the Training Material of which this Training Material is a part (e.g., the Training Material could be a chapter that isPartOf a book, or a slide-set that isPartOf a course).

If this varies in CourseInstances, use the featuredIn property  Schema.org: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.
Inverse property: [hasPart](http://schema.org/hasPart).

keywords.title: keywords (Minimum)
keywords.description: Schema.org: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

learningOutcome.title: learningOutcome (Recommended)
learningOutcome.description: Schema.org: Statements that describe what knowledge, skills or abilities students should acquire on completion of this Training Material

learningResourceType.title: learningResourceType (Recommended)
learningResourceType.description: Bioschemas: This may also include things such as video lecture, e-Learning module, or tutorial. Schema.org: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

license.title: license (Recommended)
license.description: Bioschemas: If there is a licence it must be added. Schema.org: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

mentions.title: mentions (Recommended)
mentions.description:
Bioschemas: Data-sets, tools, technologies, entities, other training materials in the series, etc., to which this Training Material makes reference.

See ‘uses’ for resources that are actively utilised in this training material. Schema.org: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

name.title: name (Minimum)
name.description: Schema.org: The name of the item.

skillLevel.title: skillLevel (Recommended)
skillLevel.description: Schema.org: The target skill level in the topic being taught. Examples of skill levels include ‘beginner’, ‘intermediate’ or ‘advanced’.

status.title: status (Optional)
status.description: Schema.org: The status of a training material. If this is not filled in it will be regarded as Active. Options are Active, Under development, and Archived.

timeRequired.title: timeRequired (Recommended)
timeRequired.description: Bioschemas: Please specify in [ISO 8601 duration format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601). Schema.org: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.

translatedInto.title: translatedInto (Optional)
translatedInto.description: Schema.org: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also [availableLanguage](http://schema.org/availableLanguage). Supersedes language.

url.title: url (Recommended)
url.description: Bioschemas: The preferred URL of the Training Material. You must provide this value if it is known. Schema.org: URL of the item.

uses.title: uses (Recommended)
uses.description: Bioschemas: Data-sets, tools, technologies, entities, etc. that are actively utilised in this Training Material. Schema.org: Lists datasets, tools, technologies, or other entities used.

version.title: version (Optional)
version.description: Bioschemas: If this Training Material is versioned, it is strongly recommended that you use this property to indicate its version name or number.  Schema.org: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.
